page.title: 11THE PRIEST CONT.
page.content: His services too are unusual. On Good Friday 1985 he led a congregation of about 80 people on a walk from Balerno to the middle of Edinburgh: A distance of 8 miles. They carried a large wooden cross and on occasions stopped and read extracts from the bible. On Easter Day they had an egg hunt while they drank wine and ate unleavened bread which was baked by a lady in his congregation. They had this service in and around the T.U. hut. This is a wooden hut near Hailesland Primary School. At Christmas he takes children round houses to sing carols but they do not collect money. Mr Brockie enjoys his work most of the time. His greatest fear is nuclear bombs. He would like everyone to live in peace and is hopeful that there will be more churches like this.
